basic_info.description_header: Hello, and Welcome to My Portfolio!
basic_info.description: My early life was defined by two main factors: Taking things apart to see how they work and then trying to put them back together. This lead me to gravitate towards certain classes in school, Engineering, Robotics, and eventually Coding. It was in coding class that these two factors really came together and work towards a common goal. My time spent coding would be spent in equal parts building the code and then trying to break it back down trying to see how it could made it better. After spending a couple formative years in a starting job, I started to pursue a new goal and attended Code Fellows.

projects.title: MadLibs Generator
projects.description: This was my Final Project for my 201 Course that I worked on with a team that takes in user input and returns a story in the MadLibs format in one of four genres.

projects.title: BusMall
projects.description: A website that takes in user input of a number between 1-9 and displays that many images that when one is clicked on, it re-renders the images with no consecutive duplicate images and once done displays a graph of the number of times an image was seen and clicked on and the data persists in local storage.
